contextId.information: This could be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "When Pharaoh tells you to do a miracle, then you will tell Aaron to take his staff and throw it down before Pharaoh, so that it may become a snake" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: When Pharaoh says to you, 'Do a miracle,' then you will say to Aaron, 'Take your staff and throw it down before Pharaoh, so that it may become a snake.'

contextId.information: The quotation can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "On that day you are to tell your children that this is because of what Yahweh did for you when you came out of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: On that day you are to say to your children, 'This is because of what Yahweh did for me when I came out of Egypt.'

contextId.information: The first quotation can be stated as an indirect quotation. AT: "When your son asks you later what this means, then you are to tell him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: When your son asks you later, 'What does this mean?' then you are to tell him

contextId.information: This can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "Pharaoh will say the Israelites are wandering in the land and the wilderness has closed in on them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: Pharaoh will say about the Israelites, 'They are wandering in the land. The wilderness has closed in on them.'

contextId.information: This can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "Then Moses asked Aaron what the people do to him, that he have brought such a great sin on them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: Then Moses said to Aaron, "What did this people ... a great sin on them?"

contextId.information: This can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "So I told them that whoever had any gold should take it off" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: So I said to them, 'Whoever has any gold, let him take it off.'

contextId.information: This can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "Then Moses stood at the entrance to the camp and said that whoever was on Yahweh's side should come to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: Then Moses stood at the entrance ... "Whoever is on Yahweh's side, come to me."

contextId.information: The can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "The craftsmen told Moses that the people were bringing much more than enough for doing the work that Yahweh has commanded them to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])
contextId.quote: The craftsmen told Moses ... commanded us to do."
